thread.title: Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, bring back ex-Bruins coach Claude Julien
thread.title_full: Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, bring back ex-Bruins coach Claude Julien

author: CBS Sports Staff
title: Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, bring back ex-Bruins coach Claude Julien
text:
Canadiens fire Michel Therrien, bring back ex-Bruins coach Claude Julien It is the second time the Habs have replaced Therrien with Julien by CBS Sports Staff 12m ago • 1 min read 
The Montreal Canadiens fired coach Michel Therrien on Tuesday , replacing him with recently fired Boston Bruins coach Claude Julien. Claude Julien appointed head coach of the Montreal Canadiens. — Canadiens Montréal (@CanadiensMTL) February 14, 2017 
The Canadiens, in first place in the Atlantic Division with 70 points, finished their season series against Boston with a 4-0 loss Sunday night. Montreal has struggled recently, losing six of seven. 
Julien, who also replaced Therrien as Canadiens coach during the 2002-03 season, will make his most recent Montreal debut Saturday against the Jets . He was fired as Bruins coach on Feb. 7 and replaced by assistant Bruce Cassidy, who has since led Boston to three straight wins. 
Therrien has won 406 games in his 12-year NHL coaching career, including 271 in his two stints with the Canadiens. Julien, the winningest coach in Bruins history, has 538 career NHL victories. Add a comment
